sys_metadata_link.payload: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update table="x_176383_star_wars_gear"> <x_176383_star_wars_gear action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"> <base_damage>0</base_damage> <critical_rating/> <defense/> <description>Scramblers are devices used to encrypt communications for privacy or security (or both). They can be affixed onto most comlinks or other similar equipment, and only those with a linked scrambler are able to follow the conversation. Their small size makes them easy to conceal, which is important since they're illegal for civilians to possess on most civilized worlds. Companies like Chedak produce models like the Mark 5 primarily for military or police use, although many end up on the black market.  Using scramblers adds 2 setback dice to any checks to attempt to decode and understand the transmission.  Models Include: Chedak Mark 5 Comm Scrambler.</description> <encumbrance>0</encumbrance> <hard_points/> <hp_required/> <name>Comm Scrambler</name> <number>GEAR0001078</number> <price>1000</price> <range/> <rarity>5</rarity> <skill_used/> <soak/> <sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by> <sys_created_on>2020-11-02 21:28:24</sys_created_on> <sys_id>54ee73642f94a450e0f497eef699b64f</sys_id> <sys_mod_count>0</sys_mod_count> <sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by> <sys_updated_on>2020-11-02 21:28:24</sys_updated_on> <type>gear</type> </x_176383_star_wars_gear> </record_update>
